title: eCupid
description: This week, Chris Haigy, Drew McFaddin and Eric Henke watched the 2011 romantic (?) comedy (?) eCupid, featuring a bunch of straight people trying to play gay, and Morgan Fairchild as a magical computer genie.
topics: Why gay movies can't seem to get kissing right
Bad boys, boy next door types, skaterboys and dirty, dirty fratboys

title: Going Down in La La Land
description: This week, the boys watched the 2011 film Going Down in La La Land, the almost certainly semi-autobiographical story of a reluctant pornstar who finds the love of America's favorite sitcom dad. Or, as it's described by Google "Friendships sustain people living in Hollywood and help them deal with the celebrity-obsessed culture."
topics: The films of Jet Set Men
Whether Chris got paid enough for posing nude

title: Eating Out
description: This week, we talked about the 2004 "sex comedy" Eating Out, which at the time was hailed as gay sexy fun. 2004 was a different time. A time of Blockbuster Video, flip phones, and questionable consent. A time when it was totally cool for men to get laid through trickery. A time when supposed allies were allowed to just make it rain gay slurs. Basically, I'm saying this movie hasn't aged well.
topics: What it meant to be early 2000's attractive
Which Doctor Who was the gayest

title: Vampire Boys
description: This week, Chris asked if we could watch the 2011 horror romance Vampire Boys, and like idiots we all said "I don't know what that is, but sure." With vampires who can go out in the sunlight, and aren't afraid of crosses, but do need the love of a mortal, it's a lot like a gay Twilight. A Twinklight, if you will.
topics: The porn that Chris pretends he doesn't watch

title: Kiss Me Kill Me
description: Hey all you cool cats and kittens, this week, we discussed the 2015 tiger-centric film Kiss Me Kill Me, a neo-noir Hollywood thrilller directed by two-time We Read Movies director Casper Andreas. When Dusty Young's rich fiance is murdered in what looks, to everyone but the characters in the movie, like a robbery gone wrong, he is blamed for the murder. Now, with the help of some sassy lesbians and a hypnotist drag queen, he'll have to find the real killer, clear his name and maybe find love along the way.
topics: How soon after your fiance is murdered is TOO soon to start a new relationship
Chris takes a break from describing the plot of this movie to describe the plot of a porno

title: Kaboom
description: This week, we talked about Greg Araki's 2010 psycho-sci-fi-sex-dramedy Kaboom. Look, I don't know how to describe this movie to you, it's crazy. Someone sees a murder, there's a lesbian witch and a doomsday cult and some very gross mac and cheese.
topics: What kind of dickpics we'd like to receive in our inbox (wereadmovies@gmail.com)
How big a cock you'd need to gag three people with it at the same time
The proper way to eat pussy like it's spaghetti

title: Another Gay Movie
description: This week, we talked about another gay movie, specifically, the gay movie Another Gay Movie, a parody of the raunchy screwball sex comedies (ike American Pie). Has it aged well? Does it go way too far in the raunchy direction? Why does Drew keep defending it? WHY?!
topics: How many is too many poop jokes?
Whether quiche is even any good
Seriously, why does Drew like this movie?

title: SHORTS - Hey, Google
description: We're trying something new today! We noticed a glut of bad gay short films on our streaming services, and decided, on our off weeks, that maybe we'd talk briefly about those. So if an hour and a half of us yammering in your ears every two weeks just isn't enough, now you can hear us talk for twenty more minutes about a short film it only takes ten minutes to watch.
topics: How soon is too soon for a pandemic related story?
Why you probably shouldn't make a movie that makes the watcher's smart device chime every 30 seconds

title: The 10 Year Plan
description: Best friends (who don't seem to actually like each other very much) Myles and Brody make a pact that they'll be boyfriends if they're still single in 10 years in this JC Calciano entry from 2014. It's your typical rom-com setup, but will there be a twist this time? Does the fact that it's not funny or romantic count?
topics: What should and should not go inside the human body
The amazingness that is the movie Scoob

title: SHORTS - Legally Blonde
description: This week, for our bonus short, we begin by talking about Chris in the shower, and end up talking about that scene in Legally Blonde where Enrique the poolboy gets outed for knowing about designer shoes. It's a wild ride.

title: Bear City
description: This week, the boys watched the 2010 film Bear City, a hairy, gay attempt at Sex and the City, that Chris has a lot of opinions about. Can a twink make it in bear's world? Can a bear make it in a twink's world? What if neither of those classifications applied and it was just a boring romantic comedy without jokes? Let's find out!

title: SHORTS - David Decoteau
description: This week, we answered the question of why we'll never do a David Decoteau movie on this podcast.
topics: Sorority Babes in the Slimeball Bowl-o-rama
Who the killer was this whole time

title: Eating Out 2: Sloppy Seconds
description: This week, we were joined by the incomparable Mike Johnson and Kyle Getz from the Gayish podcast to talk about the 2006 film Eating Out 2: Sloppy Seconds. Scream taught us that, in the sequel, the body count is always higher, the death scenes are always more elaborate, and the killer is never dead. Will those rules hold true to this tale of sexual trickery? Let's find out!
topics: What your grandfather's balls can tell you about your future
How to make models comfortable when posing for homoerotic art

title: Hot Guys With Guns
description: This week, fighting through technical difficulties, we talked about the 2013 film Hot Guys With Guns, about two ex boyfriends and wannabe private eyes who solve the crime of who robbed a bunch of Hollywood sex parties. The title is promising, can it live up to it? Probably not!
topics: The right way to commit crimes

title: SHORTS - Mulan
description: This week, we talked about the Disney animated movie Mulan, maybe you've heard of it?
topics: The use of fruit in drag

title: The Big Gay Musical
description: This week, at the request of a fan, we watched the misnamed 2009 movie The Big Gay Musical, a movie that is pretty small and not really a musical. What's going on here? It must be the work of none other than Casper Andreas.
topics: The beauty of men's ballet tights

title: SHORTS - Flamingo Pride
description: This week, we found a computer animated short called Flamingo Pride which is... bonkers. Join us as we lose our fucking minds trying to talk about it.
topics: Why geese deserve to be in jail

title: Last Ferry
description: This week, we watched the most recent movie we've done, the 2019 film Last Ferry. When a young gay lawyer sees a murder on Fire Island, he pretty much ignores it until the last five minutes of the movie when the movie goes off the rails. Fun!
topics: Hey, did you know that Chris is from New York?

title: SHORTS - Bed Buddies
description: This week, we watched the 2016 short film Bed Buddies, about what happens when best friends Brent, Jared and Danny all have a drunken threesome. Now in the cold light of sobriety they have to decide whether to stay friends or more than friends, and they have to do it while staring at Brent's comically gargantuan bulge.
topics: What slurs you're allowed to use (if in doubt, don't)

title: My Brother's Shoes
description: This week, we talked about My Brother's Shoes, a wacky body-swap comedy where two brothers swap bodies and learn a little lesson about how hard it is to pump a baby into your ovulating sister-in-law when you're a gay guy inhabiting your straight brother's body.
topics: A certain drag race alum's Nazi porn past
Freaky Friday body swaps vs Quantum Leap body swaps
Why it's so hard to get gay sex right in a gay movie

title: SHORTS - The More The Scarier
description: This week, for the spookiest month of them all, we watched a gay horror short about a horny ghost. It's only a 6 minute short, and most of that is laugh track, so most of the episode is us talking about whether or not we'd fuck a ghost.

title: Hellbent
description: The spookiest month continues with Hellbent, a 2004 gay slasher flick, about a hot guy in a devil mask who murders West Hollywood gays for... some reason. Did we lose our heads for this gorefest, or were we bored to death? Find out!
topics: We try to name a single opera
What's the best way to describe your dick?
Is it hard to get laid in drag

title: I Was a Teenage Werebear (with Sean Paul Lockhart, aka Brent Corrigan)
description: This week, we were joined by the incomparable Sean Paul Lockhart (Brent Corrigan if you're nasty) to talk about the 2011 featurette I Was a Teenage Werebear. A movie he was in! Guys, I'm geeking out over here.
topics: And we get real about some stuff

title: Pornography: A Thriller
description: This week, we talked about Pornography: A Thriller, a 2010 movie that wants you to feel bad about watching porn, but also kind of wants to show you some porn. The movie makes no sense, so if this episode feels incomprehensible, it's because we're actually doing an amazingly good job explaining it.
topics: How to get out of an unwanted party invitation

title: Third Man Out
description: This week, we watched Third Man Out, the first of the Donald Strachey mystery series produced for HereTV. Starring Chad Allen as the most famous gay private investigator in all of Albany, this movie is the fun kind of incomprehensible.
topics: Batman's claim to be the World's Greatest Detective

title: SHORTS - G O'Clock
description: This week, we talked for a very long time about the short film G O'Clock, about a chemsex party gone awry. Well, more awry.

title: Is It Just Me?
description: This week, we watched Is It Just Me? the first film by JC Calciano, and by far his worst. When sad sack Blaine finds out that he accidentally catfished Texas boy Xander, he'll have to reenact the movie The Truth About Cats and Dogs (but with a self-hating gay twist) if he wants to get the guy. Is love more important than looks? What if you're actually totally fine looking, and also if you've only known each other for like a day and a half?
topics: Why do people in movies play video games so fucking weird?

title: Walk a Mile in My Pradas
description: This week, we watched the 2011 movie Walk a Mile in My Pradas, about a straight guy who magically becomes gay thanks to Bruce Vilanch's magical Christmas ornament. Also there's a gay dude who becomes magically straight, but he's barely in the movie sooooo...
topics: The gay porn parody of The Ring

title: SHORTS - Luber
description: This week, we talked about the short gay film Luber, an exploration into the extreme depths of sadness, lust, and one man's parasite-filled butthole.
topics: Tattoos and the men who love them (Drew)

title: Midnight Kiss
description: This week, we watched Midnight Kiss, a Blumhouse presents horror movie about the dangers of kissing people on New Year's Eve, starring Captain America's brother, Scott Evans.
topics: Why Hulu is bad for seeing dong
Why does Eric think people keep condoms in the bathroom?

title: SHORTS - Andy The Talking Hedgehog
description: This week, at the suggestion of a listener who hates us, we watched the not even gay movie Andy the Talking Hedgehog. Starring Tara Reid and Dean Cain, this movie is a fascinating look into the depths of how bad a movie can actually be. We thought Pornography: A Thriller was terrible, but Andy the Talking Hedgehog has shown us how good we've actually had it. At least that movie hung dong.
topics: What should a talking cat sound like?

title: The Love Patient
description: This week, we talked about the 2011 movie The Love Patient, about an awful man who fakes having cancer to get back with his ex who's in a much better place since they broke up. Will deception bring love? Will they land the big client at their ad agency? Will there be a weird pagan orgy in the middle for some reason? Let's find out!
topics: Which Pokemon would you have sex with?
What exactly is the replicator on Star Trek using to make food?
The right way to pretend you have cancer for love and profit

title: Another Gay Sequel: Gays Gone Wild
description: This week, Isabel Anderson, who also does our amazing episode art, joined us to talk about Another Gay Sequel: Gays Gone Wild. All of us, except Drew, hated the first film, but what will this installment bring? Can it hope to surpass the nasty, crass humor of the first movie? (Hint: Yes)
topics: Which kind of merperson would you have sex with?
Chris describes the worst porno he's ever seen

title: Vampire Boys 2: The New Brood
description: This week, along with our special guests Butch Alice and Anya Knees, we talked about the 2013 film Vampire Boys 2: The New Brood. With naked fight scenes, bad accents, and mind control powers, it should be a hit. Is it? Probably not, but let's find out!

title: SHORTS - Do We Really Have To Say Goodbye?
description: This week, we talked about the short film Do We Really Have to Say Goodbye, a gay covid tale with a twist ending that's so short we padded it out with a list of movies Chris has cried at on planes. It's weirder than you think.
topics: Movies Chris has cried at on planes
Speaking of planes, who gave Baloo the Bear flight technology?

title: Judas Kiss
description: This week, we watched the 2011 time travel drama Judas Kiss. When failed director Zach agrees to judge a film competition at his old alma mater, he magically travels back in time and meets himself as a student. Does he have sex with himself? You bet he does. Does anything else happen? Let's find out!
topics: Would you have sex with past you?
How many time travel references can we make? Hint: it's a lot

title: SHORTS - Jackplot
description: This week, we watched the 2020 British short film Jackplot. For a movie with the word plot in the title, there's not a lot of it, so mostly we just talked about a DC/Frasier crossover. Join us, won't you?
topics: How much money would it take for you to kill your husband?
What if it was in British money?
What even is British money? How does it work?

title: Shock to the System
description: This week, we watched the 2006 Shock to the System, the second in the Donald Strachey series of mysteries. Join us as we return to the Dirty Albs, and try solve a mystery so confusing that the country's most famous gay detective doesn't even know what the mystery is.
topics: Chris describes a porno he should have described last episode

title: The Wolves of Kromer
description: This week, we watched the 1998 film The Wolves of Kromer. In a world where gay people are some sort of werewolves who live in the British countryside and eat old ladies, can we ever learn to get along with our straight neighbors? If this concept sounds wild, it's because it is.

title: Ben and Arthur
description: For our birthday episode, we watched the 2002 film Ben and Arthur, widely regarded as the worst gay movie in the world. Possibly even the worst movie in the world. Does it live up to the hype? You best believe it does! Did we love every second of it? Heck yeah we did!
topics: Interesting uses for nail polish remover
More psychopaths than you can shake an extra large dildo at
Did we mention that this movie is bonkers?

title: Crisis Hotline
description: This week, we watched the 2019 movie Crisis Hotline. When Simon, a jaded LGBT Crisis Hotline operator, gets a call from someone who claims he's going to kill some porn producers, he has to... sit patiently on the phone until the guy eventually gets to his point. It's a very boring thriller, is our point.
topics: The steps in the standard gay dating tango
Meeting your boyfriend's bosses' boss, who's also a creepy sex trafficker

title: Demons
description: This week, we watched the 2017 short film Demons. In a world where murder is normal, but being gay is weird and gross, can a gay serial killer find acceptance and... maybe even love?
topics: Piss play is not our thing, but if it's yours it's cool, just don't be a bad person about it
What if Air Bud played other sports?

title: Eating Out: All You Can Eat
description: This week, Mike and Kyle of Gayish are back to talk about Eating Out: All You Can Eat. The third in the Eating Out Series, this film features a brand new (mostly) cast of characters but the same old sexual trickery. But can it live up to the "second highest rating of the series" at 17%? Turns out, it can!
topics: How much jizz is too much?
Is it gay if it's in a threesome with two other dudes?
The ever deepening mystery of why Eric thinks people keep condoms in bathrooms in movies

title: The Gay Bed and Breakfast of Terror
description: This week, we watched the 2007 horror comedy The Gay Bed and Breakfast of Terror. Not nearly as campy as the title promised, this film follows five separate couples as they all get murdered by an evil slug boy and his creepy family. What is the story behind these monstrous murderers? Will anyone survive? Let's find out!
topics: What would you call a racist dog?

title: Daddy (with Minoritea Report)
description: This week, we watched the 2015 movie Daddy. An older man who once donated sperm in college, and now has a habit of hooking up with younger guys, meets the young guy of his dreams, and it turns out, wouldn't you know it, that they're actually related.
topics: Not shaking your dick after peeing
Having sex in a dorm room as an adult

title: The Dark Place
description: This week, we watched the 2014 movie The Dark Place. When Keegan Dark (definitely a real person's name), a young guy with a perfect memory, comes home to find his estranged mother has remarried and his new step brother is a possibly murderous guy with an amazing body, he has to solve the mystery of what the hell is going on in this movie.
topics: What if JK Simmons was in Fifty Shades of Gray

title: Mulligans
description: Happy Father's Day! If you thought we'd had enough of dad sex, you've clearly never found our internet search history, so this week we watched the 2008 movie Mulligans. Best friends Tyler and Chase come home for the summer but Chase soon finds that... well, it's not quite love, but he finds that he'd maybe give sex with Tyler's Dad a chance. Does it blossom into something beautiful? Will the family find out this dark secret? Did Chase bring his shower shot from college? Let's find out!
topics: Would you have sex with someone's dad?

title: Unhappy Birthday
description: This week, we talked about the 2010 movie Unhappy Birthday, which is hailed, in the Amazon description,as "a queer take on the Wicker Man" in that it's also British. When Sadie, her boyfriend, and her boyfriend's boyfriend are all trapped on a mysterious island that's maybe haunted (and also there's a cult or something?) they'll have to escape if they want to avoid becoming baby-making surrogates to a full-grown woman in a dress made for a child's purity ring ceremony. If that description sounds confusing, just wait, because this movie makes zero sense. Can our hosts get through it? Let's find out!
topics: James Watson looks like an absolute ghoul
Insulting people's fathers in their own homes
Having a threeway with the door open

title: Knife+Heart
description: This week, we watched the somewhat confusing but genuinely enjoyable French thriller Knife+Heart. A killer is stalking the cast of a gay porn studio with a dildo knife, and only Anne, the studio's alcoholic lesbian producer is taking it seriously. But can she navigate the a world of magical birds and dinosaur handed men to save the day in time?
topics: Seriously, what's the point of fluffers?
Everything we know about France we learned from EricVideos
Birds that eat death and then fly to sun

title: Say Yes
description: This week, we watched the 2018 movie, Say Yes, about a woman with terminal cancer, who's last and most serious wish is that after she dies, her husband will have sex with her twin brother. If that sounds weird as heck, just buckle yourselves in!
topics: Rolling a nat 20 on your persuasion check

title: Somefarwhere
description: Everyone, this week's episode was tough on all of us. This movie doesn't make a bit of sense, and Eric may never forgive us for making him watch it. We watched the 2011 movie Somefarwhere, about a guy who goes to an unnamed Middle Eastern country to rescue his army boyfriend, and along the way gets tangled up in a plot not even the writer/director understands. Come along with us on this journey, but don't expect to understand it any better than we do.
topics: Trying to intimidate someone in a room equipped with a clapper
No Shirt, No Shoes, No Service
Everyone go watch the movie Society

title: Steam Room Stories: The Movie
description: This week, we watched the 2019 movie Steam Room Stories: The Movie, based on the long running queerbait-y web series of the same name. When an evil cosmetics mogul (Tracy Lords) tries to take over a steam room that's also the legendary Fountain of Youth, it's up to five studs, as stupid as they are sexy, to save the day.

title: Boy Culture
description: This week, because the long awaited sequel series is supposed to be coming out any day now, we talked about the 2006 film Boy Culture. Set in our hometown of Seattle, the film centers around X, an $5000/hr male prostitute who slut shames his friends, is casually racist and generally sucks. Can he find love with his roommate, even though he doesn't deserve it? Let's find out!
topics: The economics of extremely high-end escorts
Seattle businesses that don't exist anymore
A tight five on Mr Peanut
What if McGruff the Crime Dog teamed up with a bird to solve murders?

title: Angels With Tethered Wings
description: This week, we watched the soft core porn pretending to be an actual movie Angels With Tethered Wings. When twink porn stars Grant and Timmy are murdered, they come back as zombies for revenge. And also there's a missing briefcase full of money, and an undercover mob boss, and a gravedigger who has sex with corpses, and a million flashbacks. This movie is impossible to explain, so listen to us stumble around trying to for a long time!
topics: The differences between zombies and angels

title: Spiral
description: This week, getting in the Halloween spirit early, we watched the 2019 horror movie Spiral. When a former club kid (Jeffrey Bowyer-Chapman) moves to the suburbs with his wet blanket husband, he uncovers a cult that plans to use homophobia to live forever. Also he meets a ghost who hands him some video tapes that explain the whole plot but that he refuses to watch.
topics: The strange racket that is Neapolitan pizza

title: Cthulhu
description: This week, we watched the 2007 film Cthulhu, a very loose gay retelling of the HP Lovecraft story,The Shadow Over Innsmouth. With an ambitious story, over the top acting, some truly terrible wigs and Tori Spelling, how could it not be great?
topics: How many babies could you beat up?
The Cult of The Jerk Shack
Chris read the book and he's not gonna shut up about it
Spoilers, but Cthulhu never shows up

title: Homewrecker
description: This week, we talked about the 2009 movie Homewrecker, a movie where the cover prominently advertises that it features Tiffany from the Eating Out Series. When a wannabe actor infiltrates the home of two gay tv producers, he'll do everything he can to be in their next show, including a very convoluted and incoherent plot to break them up or something. Can they thwart his evil advances? Can they finish the concept for their new reality show? Will Tiffany actually make an appearance? Let's find out!
topics: Having sex through a hole in a sheet
Let's all hate on James Corden a little
We body shame people more attractive than us

title: On the Other Hand, Death
description: This week, we watched the third in the Donald Strachey mystery movies, On the Other Hand Death. When a greedy land developer plans to do something confusingly illegal, it's up to the world's greatest gay detective Donald Strachey to save a lesbian couple from being run out of town. Can he solve the case, or will they have to move to Vermont and open up a B&B (which is their actual plan)?
topics: Why do elephants have trunks and not tentacles?
How does Kel feel about Keenan's success?

title: Everything is Free
description: This week, we talked about the 2017 movie Everything is Free. When Ivan, an American painter living in Colombia, is visited by his straight best friend, Cole, and Cole's supposedly straight younger brother, Christian, Ivan and Christian start confusingly falling in love. Also they meet a cult leader who worms his way into their house, but that doesn't really matter to the plot that much.
topics: Chris names some nu metal bands he knows
We used to think straight people existed

title: The Christmas Setup
description: This week, we watched the 2020 Lifetime movie,The Christmas Setup. When an overbearing mother (Fran Drescher) sets her son up with a handsome millionaire computer genius who invented an app that can tell the future, he's initially annoyed. But soon he comes to realize that this guy is actually kind of a catch. Also they save an abandoned train station that's in danger of being torn down to make room for something that would actually help people.
topics: Chris's ex wrote a song praising his butt
Drew's mother hasn't seen a movie since 1988
Eric has a lot of opinions about sandwiches

title: SHORTS - Catfish Killer
description: This week, we're bringing you our lost short episode, The Catfish Killer. The movie's about a guy and he's slashing people who catfished him, but that's not important and we barely talk about it. We mostly do some Fast and Furious ASMR.
topics: Which Mario character would be into NFTs?
Using hashtags in front of words
The Fast and also The Furious
A gritty Pete and Pete horror movie where Petunia issues dark commands

title: Strapped
description: This week, we watched the too-pretentious-even-for-Chris 2010 movie Strapped. When a hustler becomes trapped in an Alice in Wonderland like apartment building, he's gotta unsexily bone his way out, changing his personality and name with each encounter. And maybe, just maybe, the studio execs will decide that he needs to find love along the way.
topics: How did Nixon like to self-pleasure?
How much would you charge for a kiss?
Would Kirby give better head than Nancy Reagan?

title: Complete Strangers
description: This week, we watched the 2020 movie Complete Strangers. When a guy with retrograde amnesia meets a guy who is very clearly trying to murder him, they instantly fall in love. What follows makes even less sense than that premise. Will our hero survive? Will our podcast hosts?
topics: We're super bad at accents, but we're better than the actors are

title: D'Agostino
description: This week, we watched the 2012 movie D'Agostino, which bills itself as an gay movie, and which had us all sold the minute we saw the description in Tubi used the words "human clone." Is it one of the most wild movies we've ever talked about? Yes. Is it actually gay? Well.... Find out!
topics: How long does it take to make a stew?

title: Wedding Wars
description: This week, we watched the 2006 John-Stamos-plays gay TV movie Wedding Wars. When a gay wedding planner finds out that his brother is deeply homophobic, he organizes a gay strike that spoiler alert goes nowhere and does nothing. But we've got a star studded cast at least!
topics: The many problems plaguing the town of Derry, Maine
The very on the nose naming of Gay dot com

title: Groupers
description: This week, we watched the incoherent 2019 moVie "Groupers". What starts as an Incoherent revenge plot to turn two homophobeS gay by connEcting them at the dick gets even weirder when a ganG of neo-nazis show up to Ruin everything. And if thAt description makes it sound like the fun kind of baD, you've been fooled the same way we were.
topics: Skipping the pivotal first thirty seconds of a movie

links.text: Buy "Visegrad: A Novel" by Duncan Robertson

title: Querelle
description: This week, we watched the classic gay art house film Querelle. Ostensibly about murder, sailors and sex, it goes off the rails as soon as a lusty ship's lieutenant starts recording his inner most thoughts, and we have an absolute blast with it.
topics: How to masturbate without getting jizz on your pajamas
Thoughts of the sea naturally leading to thoughts of murder
It's not gay if you enjoy it

links.text: Buy "Visegrad: A Novel" by Duncan Robertson

title: Red Ribbon Blues
description: This week, we watched Red Ribbon Blues, a 1996 HIV medication heist film starring Paul Mercurio, Lipsinka, Debi Mazar, and RuPaul, but don't get too excited by the cast because it's not very good. It does, however, introduce us to a certain cop named Detective Bones.
topics: What could these red ribbons mean
We're making an art wish list
The unfortunate history of the appetite suppressing chocolate called Ayds

links.text: Duncan Robertson presents Visegrad at Capitol Cider
Buy "Visegrad: A Novel" by Duncan Robertson

title: Death Drop Gorgeous
description: This week, we watched the 2020 movie Death Drop Gorgeous. Not to confused with that other movie with a similar name, this one is about a slasher stalking the streets of gay Providence, RI. Can the case be solved by a down on his luck bartender, or an aging drag queen, or a pair of detectives one of whom looks like he's a literal baby? Or is one of the aforementioned people secretly the killer? Let's find out!
topics: That episode of Star Trek where they all get horny for each other
Glory holes and what might be behind them
Way too much Drag Race talk even for us

title: B&B
description: This week, the very funny and excellent Duncan Robertson (author of Visegrad: A Novel) joined us to talk about the 2017 film B&B. When husbands Marc and Fred return to the B&B they were kicked out of one year ago for being gay, they find themselves embroiled in a murder plot so weird that even after talking about it for several hours, we're still a little hazy on the details. Will they survive the night? Is that hot Russian gangster there to kill them or bang them? What kind of a B&B doesn't have wifi and why would anyone stay there? Let's find out!
topics: How many drinks would it take to turn a guy gay?
The Chuck Tingle Tabletop Roleplaying Game

links.text: Buy "Visegrad: A Novel" by Duncan Robertson

title: Kept Boy
description: Sorry it's late! Chris decided to eat at a disreputable but delicious teriyaki place and then be bedridden for 3 days with the worst case of food poisoning he's ever had, but this week, we watched the 2017 movie Kept Boy. When an aging sugar baby feels his boyfriend falling for the pool boy, he tries to win him back through trickery. But is it really him who's being tricked? Or the audience, by the most ridiculous twist ending we've ever seen? Also, will this experience teach Chris anything about being more selective about where he eats? Probably not
topics: Chris describes more of the gay porno "Boy Band"
That time when Elon Musk injecting twink blood

title: Hold Your Peace
description: This week, Chris texted the group while drunk on a Wednesday at 12:30am and said "guys we NEED to do the 2011 movie Hold Your Peace. The movie is super boring, it's about a guy who's trying to break up his ex's wedding. But the bachelor party scene is incredible!" (There were a lot more spelling errors in the text, but we sheltered you from that.) Was Chris right? Was the bachelor party incredible, or merely deeply upsetting? Let's find out!
topics: Straight Simpson's incest porn pop-ups on gay websites
What's the sluttiest kind of clothing and why is it a tuxedo?

title: Stonewall
description: This week, because it's Pride Month, we talked about the 2015 movie Stonewall, the movie that asked, what if we took a real event and replaced almost all the black people in it with one bland white dude? Also, they throw in a little fem shaming and a weird third act kidnapping.
topics: Gay directors making gay movies for straight people
Mercifully we DON'T talk about kink at Pride discourse
Is J. Edgar Hoover in this movie?

title: SHORTS - Stonewall and Queer Pop Culture (with Matt Baume)
description: This week, as a supplement to our episode on Stonewall, we had the incomparable Matt Baume on to talk to us about queer representation both before and after the Stonewall riots. Join us as we learn about the history of queer portrayals in media, from anti-gay propaganda films up to that time Archie Bunker met a trans woman.

title: Cruising
description: This week, we watched the 1980 Al Pacino movie Cruising, about a serial killer stalking the gay S&M cruising community, and the undercover cop who maybe catches him. Or maybe is the killer himself? The movie's very confusing, but what we do know is that someone's getting fisted in the background of one of the scenes, so we're on board!
topics: How can Punch and Judy be more fun?
One of the wildest scenes we've ever seen
How to catch a serial killer who has no sperm

title: Shadowlands
description: This week, we watched the 2018 movie anthology. No, not that Shadowlands... No, not that Shadowlands either... The other one. The gay one. Okay, well, they made a gay movie called Shadowlands and someone fucks a ghost in it. It's not surprising that you've never heard of it, but I promise you it's real. You can watch it on Tubi if you want, but don't bother, it wasn't good. Anyway, that's the movie we watched this week.
topics: Which painting would you have sex with?
The mysterious death of Edgar Allan Poe

title: House of Adam
description: This week, we watched the 2006 movie House of Adam. Done by the same director as past episode D'Agostino, this movie purports to be a gay ghost story, but the ghost doesn't show up for until the last 5 minutes or so. Instead we get about 40 minutes of corporate intrigue, some straight people who are very game for violating the Geneva Conventions in the name of justice, and an unintentionally hilarious hate crime.
topics: Eric is able to remember the name of Kyra Sedgwick
No, seriously, what is Detective School?

title: Ice Blues
description: This week, we watched the fourth and final (until we get that Kickstarter off the ground) movie in the Donald Strachey mysteries, Ice Blues. The most comprehensible and therefore the least fun of the series, it's also his least gay, but don't worry, we'll still find plenty to talk about, like how much killing a man with his bare hands seems to turn Strachey's husband on.
topics: What would you name your lawfirm?
This title doesn't make any sense

title: At the End of the Day
description: This week, we watched the 2018 gay christian movie At the End of the Day, about a bigot who learns, through subterfuge and the power of love, to be slightly less bigotted. Featuring inappropriate pranks and even more inappropriate eating, the movie left us with a couple of questions, like "is this even a gay movie?"
topics: Why is Bruce a gay name?
Monster energy drink is not one of god's creations

title: They/Them (with Adam Sass)
description: This week, for Spooky Season we watched the recent LGBTQ+ Kevin Bacon horror movie They/Them, about a killer who's stalking a gay conversion camp. Except, it's barely a horror movie, since the kids are in no danger, and the only people getting slashed are the jerks who run the camp. And because it bares a certain similarity to his book, Surrender Your Sons, we invited Adam Sass to come talk about it with us.
topics: Tim Curry's hatred of Scrappy Doo
Victorian babydoll heads on grown men's bodies

links.text: Buy "The 99 Boyfriends of Micah Summers" by Adam Sass
Buy "Surrender Your Sons" by Adam Sass

title: Nightmare on Elm Street 2: Freddy's Revenge
description: It's every gay's favorite holiday, Halloween! So to get into the spooky spirit we watched the not-explicitly-gay-but-oh-so-gay horror movie Nightmare on Elm Street 2: Freddy's Revenge. Featuring several naked male butts, a very sexual shower death, and rubber play sheets, this is perhaps the gayest movie we've ever done.
topics: What does Freddy Kruger's dick look like?
Birds are a weird pet to have

title: My Fake Boyfriend
description: This week, we watched the recent Buzzfeed Productions movie My Fake Boyfriend, an incoherent tale of what happens when you make a fake boyfriend for social media, but afterwards realize you want to be with a handsome chef whose arms are muscular beyond belief. Also, it asks the very important question, is there such a thing as a celebrity stunt man?
topics: The suspicious death of Swedish economist Dag Hammarskjöld
How to tell your mom you're just "regular gay" without disappointing her

title: A Wedding Most Strange
description: This week, we talked for a solid three and a half hours about the 85 minute long movie A Wedding Most Strange, and then Chris painstakingly took out a bunch of weird tangents to cut it down to the length it is now. The movie was so very deeply and maniacally weird that it just broke our brains. Listen along to our descent into madness.
topics: Drag queens with the worst fashions
What if this movie starred the lead singer of The Cure?

title: Kiss Me Deadly
description: This week, we watched the Shannen Doherty and Robert Gant gay spy thriller Kiss Me Deadly, produced for Here TV. Well, one of us did. The other two watched a straight-washed recut of this movie aired at appearing on other networks, and it takes us a really long time to figure out that we watched basically a different movie.
topics: Eric is finally finished with Charmed
Why do people think allergies aren't real?
Everything should be part of the Kenny Kwon-iverse

title: Dashing in December
description: This week, we're late in discussing the Hallmark original Christmas movie Dashing in December. It's your standard Hallmark fare, guy from the big city tries to shut down the struggling horse ranch his mom (Andie MacDowell) owns, only to fall in love with her employee. We know, we know, we meant to do it before Christmas, but stuff happened.

title: Socket
description: This week, we watched the very strange and David Cronenberg-ian 2007 movie Socket. After he's struck by lightning and develops electricity vampire powers, a doctor joins up with a group of other electricity vampires for a party-and-play metaphor that ends in multiple murders. Does it make sense? Not really. Does it involve some plug and socket-related body horror? You better believe it does.
topics: Underwear designed for people with small butts

title: Too Much Sun
description: This week, we watched the 1990 Eric Idle, Andrea Martin, Robert Downey Jr., and Ralph Macchio movie Too Much Sun. After a murdered millionaire's will stipulates that one of his gay children will have to produce a child of their own, they'll have to engage in some wacky farcical adventures to get their inheritance. Will they succeed? Does Eric Idle play gay offensively? Is Robert Downey Jr on coke for the whole movie? Does a gay guy do oral on a woman? Let's find out!
topics: We used to think gloryholes existed
Why did women find Michael Douglas attractive?
How much money would it take for you to have sex with a woman?

title: Eating Out: Drama Camp (with Mike and Kyle of Gayish)
description: This week, we invited our good friends Mike and Kyle back to watch the fourth and most excruciating of the Eating Out movies: Drama Camp. A camp of queer people out in the woods, secret identities, bizarre rules against sex? It sounds like the hit Kevin Bacon movie They/Them, but no, the only thing this movie slashed was our free time. Come join us for the Q. Allan Brocka movie that made us say "you know, now that I think about it, the second one wasn't that bad."
topics: What if cuckold porn followed the biological definition of the word?

title: I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry
description: This week, for the podcast's three-year birthday, after threatening to do it for so long, we decided to torture ourselves by watching the Kevin James and Adam Sandler movie I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry. That's right we sat through every minute of this TWO HOUR LONG movie (that's about an hour and a half of fat jokes) so that you don't have to. CONTENT WARNING: This movie uses sexual assault as a punchline a lot, and we discuss the movie doing that.
topics: The many better scripts of Alexander Payne
What's the deal with Nick Swardson?
Fellas, is it gay to have good hip flexibility?

title: Swallowed
description: This week, we watched the 2022 body horror (or so we were led to believe) movie Swallowed. When a gay guy and his best straight friend get roped into being drug mules, they find out that the condoms full of drugs they swallowed to cross the Canadian border were actually weirdo bug eggs that are hatching inside of them. And then there's an extended fisting scene.

title: Back Soon
description: This week, we watched the 2007 Rob Williams (not to be confused with Robin Williams) movie Back Soon. When a straight drug dealer gets a horny dead lady's ghost inside his body, he turns gay for her widower, who turns gay for him too through the power of sleepwalking. It's a very confusing plot, but it's also very boring.
topics: The difference between Ding Dongs, HoHos and Cupcakes (hint, there isn't one)

title: Love or Whatever
description: This week, we watched the 2012 rom(?)-com(?) Love Or Whatever, the film that dared to ask the question, "can bi people be trusted?" And that also dares to answer the question, "no. They cannot." Also, it dares to ask the question, "what's Meredith from the Office been up?" And the answer to that question will shock you.
topics: People who think puppets are people
How many sex positions are there, exactly?
The Same Girl song doesn't make any sense

title: Triple Crossed
description: This week, after some mild technical difficulties, we're back! And we watched the 2013 gay hitman flick Triple Crossed, starring and directed by the very good sport friend of the pod Sean Paul Lockhart. When an ex-marine is given a job to kill the ex boyfriend of his friend and sometimes lover... you know what? This plot is incomprehensibe. But we had fun with it anyway.
topics: The laws around faking your own death

title: Fire Island (but not THAT one)
description: This week, we watched the 2023 slasher movie Fire Island, not to be confused with the 2022 rom-com Fire Island. It may or may not be a sequel to past We Read Movies flick Last Ferry (it is), and it may or may not even be a gay movie, but we have fun with it.
topics: What straight people think drag is

title: Deadly Skies
description: This week, we watched the 2006 made for HereTV movie Deadly Skies, starring future neo-con Antonio Sabato Jr. When a planet killer asteroid threatens to crash into the Earth, it's up to a plucky band of scientists and two gay Air Force guys to save the world by turning on a secret laser everyone knows about but no one wants them to use. This is another HereTV movie that they made with a gay version and a straight version, although this time we all got on the same page and watched the gay version.
topics: We tantalize Drew by describing some bad tattoos we've seen recently

title: Love, Simon
description: This week, we watched the 2018 young adult film Love, Simon, a movie that's about 50% emails. When a closeted gay teen is blackmailed with emails that he sent to another closeted gay teen, it leads to a dramatic coming out that will have everyone in his life going "Oh, okay. That's fine."
topics: How many emails do I have to wait before I send a dick pic?

title: The Men Next Door
description: This week, we watched the 2012 Rob Williams film The Men Next Door. When a sad sack without any real friends starts dating both a father and his son at the same time, he has to make a choice, and it'll involve retelling the story to four different people in great detail.
topics: Chris describes The Green Lantern is Gay!: An XXX Porn Parody

title: Red, White and Royal Blue
description: This week, we (along with 6 million straight women) watched the 2023 movie Red, White and Royal Blue. A Rom-Com (but hold the com, please) about the son of a US president falling in love with the Prince of England. Despite being about gay people, it seems to have been made exclusively for a straight audience, and boy do we have some thoughts about that.
topics: The President and Vice President should be best friends

title: Open Cam
description: This week, we watched the 2005 film Open Cam, which only served to reinforce for Chris that he's getting older and will someday die. A serial killer is stalking the streets of Washington DC, and specifically targeting the men in a DC based cam site, but don't worry because a mysterious gay detective (who may or may not be a ghost) is on the case. Will they figure out who did it before the audience does? Is the sex in this movie really happening? Why do all the dicks look so pixelated? Let's find out!
